channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 sides of tunnel blocked, 12th February
item.description:
The 2 eastern sides(woolwich/shooters hill) of the footpath were blocked.

item.title: Underpass completely flooded, 12th February
item.description:
I am writing to report that the underpass at Sun in the Sand is completely flooded and currently impassable.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A102, Kidbrooke, Greater London

item.title: Large deep hole around man hole unavoidable, 12th February
item.description:
Large deep hole along dartford road by temp traffic lights on the opposite side hole is so deep has filled with water and puncturing tyres this has been reported several times and been ignored now the road works are there this is almost unavoidable
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dartford Road, Coldblow, Greater London

On the bridge crossing into shad thames

item.title: Street Light Not Working, 12th February
item.description:
In Kent House Approach the street light with the asset ID K-462 is not working. Please can you investigate and fix? Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Approach, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding on both carriage way and pavement, 12th February
item.description:
Server flooding at the junction if westhorn av Greenway near traffic lights . Going towards roundabout. This is always flooding at present it's a serious hazzard for people with disabilities especially the blind. The water is flooding both roads and pavement an accident waiting to happen . I don't believe there is drain but it needs one.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Eltham Hill, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Why did they leave the pallet, 12th February
item.description:
I reported a fly tip. They came and cleared most of it, why did they leave the pallet??? Please can it be removed, it's not going to vanish?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Wyvil Road, Vauxhall, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Iverson road - around 84, 12th February
item.description:
I have noticed that my entire building vibrates at least 100 times a day as cars and big trucks so past. This started and has increased since the building work on Maygrove road. I think something is wrong and needs to be investigated.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 82-104, Iverson Road, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Silver Astra on the Cnr Bognor and Gipsy Road, 12th February
item.description:
There is an abandoned car with windows open on the CNR Bognor and Gipsy Road, on double yellow lines. Number plates are scratched out.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bognor Road, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Phoenix close street sign faded, 12th February
item.description:
Street sign is above tenants house and no one ever finds it as is in an awkward place. Deliveries, post are always an issue. The sign is now faded too. Can this be taken down and get a new sign placed in a better place not on the tenants actual home
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Phoenix Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Basketball hoop broken, 12th February
item.description:
Basketball hoop has been broken for some time, it’s the only thing the older youth have to do in the area, everything else is for the young children.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Albion Drive, Hackney, London

item.title: Bags of open rubbish uncollected, 12th February
item.description:
These bags of rubbish have been by the side of the bike hangar for over a week now. Foxes have now been at them and there’s used sanitary towels now strewn across the pavement.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Millfields Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Road is cracked subsided, 12th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 107, Wellington Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, Greater London

item.title: Beyond a joke - long term solution needed, 12th February
item.description:
